positions.subtitle: UC San Diego
positions.description: CENG 101A - Fluid Mechanics, CENG 101B - Heat Transfer- Committed and passionate teaching assistant with experience supporting instructors and engaging with students in educational settings. - Collaborated closely with professors and fellow teaching assistants to develop and implement course materials, grade assignments, and provide one-on-one or group tutoring to students. - Demonstrated ability to foster student engagement, facilitate discussions, and offer constructive feedback. - Proven track record of successful teamwork, professional growth, and a commitment to making a positive impact in education.

CENG 101A - Fluid Mechanics, CENG 101B - Heat Transfer

positions.subtitle: UC San Diego
positions.description: Thesis Projects:(1) Modulating chemical environment on copper sulfate for efficient CO2 to formate conversion:- Utilized ligands capped copper sulphide nano-materials to optimize the proton availability on the catalyst for CO2 electrolysis. - Prepared inks and monolayered nano-materials collaboratively using the Langmuir-Schaefer process and quantified the loading using ICP-MS. - CO2 electrolysis was performed on a custom H-Cell, achieving an impressive 70.15% Faradaic Efficiency towards formic acid at lower overpotentials, comparable to state-of-the-art catalysts.(2) Tuning the oxidation state of tin oxide and enhancing the mass transport of CO2 for CO2 electro-reduction to formate in a zero gap MEA electrolyzer.- Utilized the Physical Vapor Deposition (PVD) technique, etching, and drop casting technique to synthesize tin oxide nanomaterial and anode, respectively. - Studied the effect of CO2 flow-rate and concentration on a Tin oxide catalyst for CO2 electro-reduction reaction. - Electrolysis was performed in a catholyte-free MEA based electrolyzer and facile mass transport of CO2 by utilizing Gas Diffusion Electrode (GDE), achieving an impressive 80% Faradaic Efficiency towards formic acid which has the breakthrough to achieve net negative carbon emissions.- Seeking new opportunities to contribute my skills and knowledge in catalysis and electrochemistry to tackle pressing challenges in sustainable energy and environmental conservation.
positions.title: Graduate Student Researcher
positions.description_html:
Thesis Projects:

(1) Modulating chemical environment on copper sulfate for efficient CO2 to formate conversion:
- Utilized ligands capped copper sulphide nano-materials to optimize the proton availability on the catalyst for CO2 electrolysis.
- Prepared inks and monolayered nano-materials collaboratively using the Langmuir-Schaefer process and quantified the loading using ICP-MS.
- CO2 electrolysis was performed on a custom H-Cell, achieving an impressive 70.15% Faradaic Efficiency towards formic acid at lower overpotentials, comparable to state-of-the-art catalysts.

(2) Tuning the oxidation state of tin oxide and enhancing the mass transport of CO2 for CO2 electro-reduction to formate in a zero gap MEA electrolyzer.
- Utilized the Physical Vapor Deposition (PVD) technique, etching, and drop casting technique to synthesize tin oxide nanomaterial and anode, respectively.
- Studied the effect of CO2 flow-rate and concentration on a Tin oxide catalyst for CO2 electro-reduction reaction.
- Electrolysis was performed in a catholyte-free MEA based electrolyzer and facile mass transport of CO2 by utilizing Gas Diffusion Electrode (GDE), achieving an impressive 80% Faradaic Efficiency towards formic acid which has the breakthrough to achieve net negative carbon emissions.

- Seeking new opportunities to contribute my skills and knowledge in catalysis and electrochemistry to tackle pressing challenges in sustainable energy and environmental conservation.

experience.title: Undergraduate Student Researcher
experience.description: Janus nanomaterials for electrochemical reactions.- Led a high-performing team of 5 in studying Nickel, Iron based bi-metallic Janus nanomaterials for electrochemical water splitting, aimed at hydrogen production. - Expertly synthesized a range of compositions and morphologies using a sonochemical approach, ensuring precise control over the material properties. - Employed advanced characterization techniques such as XRD and SEM to analyze and understand the structural and morphological features of the synthesized nanomaterials. - Conducted comprehensive Cyclic Voltammetry experiments to evaluate the electrochemical behavior of the materials, providing valuable insights into their performance. - Tested the efficacy of the synthesized nanomaterials using a PEM electrolyzer, assessing their potential for efficient water splitting and hydrogen generation. - Demonstrated strong analytical skills, meticulous attention to detail, and a deep understanding of nanomaterial synthesis and electrochemical processes. - Seeking new opportunities to apply my expertise in nanomaterials and electrochemical water splitting for impactful research and innovation in sustainable energy production.
experience.description_html: Janus nanomaterials for electrochemical reactions.- Led a high-performing team of 5 in studying Nickel, Iron based bi-metallic Janus nanomaterials for electrochemical water splitting, aimed at hydrogen production. - Expertly synthesized a range of compositions and morphologies using a sonochemical approach, ensuring precise control over the material properties. - Employed advanced characterization techniques such as XRD and SEM to analyze and understand the structural and morphological features of the synthesized nanomaterials. - Conducted comprehensive Cyclic Voltammetry experiments to evaluate the electrochemical behavior of the materials, providing valuable insights into their performance. - Tested the efficacy of the synthesized nanomaterials using a PEM electrolyzer, assessing their potential for efficient water splitting and hydrogen generation. - Demonstrated strong analytical skills, meticulous attention to detail, and a deep understanding of nanomaterial synthesis and electrochemical processes. - Seeking new opportunities to apply my expertise in nanomaterials and electrochemical water splitting for impactful research and innovation in sustainable energy production.

experience.title: Summer research
experience.description: Perovskite materials for electrochemical CO2 reduction- Conducted an in-depth study on the effect of Strontium doped Lanthanum Copper A2BO4 Perovskite Nanomaterials for CO2 reduction reaction. - Employed the solution combustion technique to successfully synthesize the perovskite materials, ensuring high purity and controlled composition. - Employed advanced characterization techniques including XRD and SEM to analyze the structural and morphological properties of the synthesized nanomaterials. - Utilized cyclic voltammetry to evaluate the electrochemical behavior of the materials, providing insights into their potential for CO2 reduction. - Collaborated with a PhD scholar to test the perovskite materials in basic aqueous electrolyzer cells, achieving an impressive 32% Faradaic Efficiency towards Methanol production. - Demonstrated strong research skills, attention to detail, and the ability to work under supervision while contributing to groundbreaking research in sustainable CO2 reduction.
experience.description_html: Perovskite materials for electrochemical CO2 reduction- Conducted an in-depth study on the effect of Strontium doped Lanthanum Copper A2BO4 Perovskite Nanomaterials for CO2 reduction reaction. - Employed the solution combustion technique to successfully synthesize the perovskite materials, ensuring high purity and controlled composition. - Employed advanced characterization techniques including XRD and SEM to analyze the structural and morphological properties of the synthesized nanomaterials. - Utilized cyclic voltammetry to evaluate the electrochemical behavior of the materials, providing insights into their potential for CO2 reduction. - Collaborated with a PhD scholar to test the perovskite materials in basic aqueous electrolyzer cells, achieving an impressive 32% Faradaic Efficiency towards Methanol production. - Demonstrated strong research skills, attention to detail, and the ability to work under supervision while contributing to groundbreaking research in sustainable CO2 reduction.
